column4: i have installed two 7.10 servers and they both have a network slowness problem which appears related to samba, both are completely diffrenet hardware, when i went to etch on one of them the problem disappeared, anyone with any clues on this ?
are you using a wins server?
no wins server,  which has been another issue, stupid windows updates turning on lmhosts lookup
either use a wins server or update the lmhosts on the linux boxes.
If it takes a long time to do anything, but it finally comes up, that's the problem.
or turn of wins lookup on the clients...
why are you saying to use a wins server ?
why would anyone want to use a wins server if you dont have to ?
wins server will have a list of all the machines, so they will not have to broadcast for them
a netbios list ?
yes
lmhosts file does the same
oh yes it will...  which would be a good idea for a samba server
winblows will try wins for a few minutes, then dns
not if lmhosts lookup is turned off
are you aware of any change in 7.10 regarding wins or samba or lookups ?
not aware of any changes.
cool thx. this slowness appears related to 7.10
whenever your trying to locate something not in its cache.
the first time you browse to server1, it queries the wins server and puts that name in its cache.
thx, thats my memory thought...
